speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, I thought you were spending the afternoon with Dad.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's in the loo.  Why don't you join us?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, thank you. [_sits_] Hey, did you happen to catch the show today?  I was on fire.  First caller was an agoraphobic -- [_fists the air_] Boom! - knocked it right out of the park. Then, two troubled marriages and a compulsive over-eater -- Boom-boom, Boom!  I was a regular mental health dispensing machine.

speaker: Daphne
text: I did two loads of laundry and cut a piece of gum out of Eddie's hair.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Daphne, don't get down on yourself.  The work you do at home is very important.  In fact, I don't know what Dad and I are going to do once you're married.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you, Dr. Crane, that makes me feel better.

speaker: Frasier
text: Boom!  Boy, there is no off-switch on this thing!

speaker: Daphne
text: Sadly, that's true. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, there she is, the other half of our team.  Roz, are you still as jazzed as I am?

speaker: Roz
text: They're taking us off the air! [_sits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: What?!  Since when?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, while you were out looking for Gatorade to pour over yourself, Kenny came by and said he's yanking us for a week. He wants to try out that new show - you know, "Car Chat with Bob and Bethany."

speaker: Frasier
text: "Car Chat with Bob and Bethany," what the... [_pauses_] Ohhh, touche, Kenny.  You are indeed a worthy adversary but you shall find I have a trick or two of my own! [_laughs_]

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, Dr. Crane, maybe a week off would do you some good.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, you don't understand.  See, I'm actually renegotiating my contract right now, this is merely the station's tactic to try and get me to cave.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I hope you're right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course I'm right; Bob and Bethany, Car chat, please! I mean how can anyone drone on for three hours about a subject that nobody even understands!

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah!  We were there first!

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't worry, Dr. Crane, I'm sure you're right about these things.  After all, you usually are.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank you, Daphne, that's exactly what I needed to hear.

speaker: Daphne
text: Boom!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sits_] Boy, they really did a job in the men's room, didn't they?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I hadn't noticed.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yeah, completely re-did it: Fancy wallpapers, bright new tiles, even those little perfumed soaps that you like to use at home, Fras.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, for heaven's sakes, you went into the ladies room, you blind old sod!  I've been begging him for months to get glasses.

speaker: Martin
text: Ladies room?!  You're crazy, that guy was just in there.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_calls over to the woman_] Oh hi, Bethany.  Listen, good luck in the slot next week.

speaker: Bethany
text: Thanks, we're pumped. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Granted, Dad, Bethany may be a bit of a tough call, but still, you know, it wouldn't hurt to get a check-up.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, don't you start too.  There's nothing wrong with my eyes. [_picks up cream holder_] Now, if you don't mind, I just want to sit here quietly and have a... [_notices the cup he picked up_] ...have a drink of cream, do you have a problem with that?!  Good.  _The rest look at him as he sips the cream.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment Daphne is cutting some coupons as Frasier enters._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hi, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, Daphne.  Say, you know my agent, Bebe, said she might be stopping by.  Have you heard anything?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, and I hope she's not staying for lunch, I'm afraid we're fresh out of live mice.  _Martin then enters wearing a pair of "old-woman" glasses.  Frasier looks at him, alarmed._

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is it my imagination or are those ladies' glasses?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, but don't you say anything.  I had to drag him down to the store.  He tried on every pair in the place, those were the only ones he liked.

speaker: Martin
text: [_enters_] So, how do you like the new specs?

speaker: Frasier
text: They certainly are eye-catching.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  You should have seen the looks I got all day.  Mostly from women.  You know, I'd like to think it was me but I've got an idea that these frames were designed with an eye to pleasing the ladies.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd say that's a safe assumption. [_laughs with Daphne_]

speaker: Martin
text: Have you seen the case for them?  I don't know what I did with it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, I think I popped them into my purse, check my room.

speaker: Martin
text: Okey-doke.  Oh, wait till you see this case, Fras.  This Loren guy really knows what he's doing. [_exits to Daphne's room_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ralph Lauren?

speaker: Daphne
text: Sophia. [_giggles_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm amazed you could keep a straight face all day.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I've done enough clothes shopping with your father. [_doorbell sounds_] I'm pretty good at pretending to like things, no matter how horrifying I find them.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_cheerful pretense_] Bebe, how nice to see you.  _Bebe peremptorily hands her coat to Daphne and enters. Daphne goes to hang it up and then exits._

speaker: Bebe
text: Frasier, my favorite client, Seattle's golden-throated gift to the airwaves.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_kissing her cheeks_] So, I take it negotiations aren't going so well?

speaker: Bebe
text: You remember that insulting figure you said you'd never accept?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Bebe
text: They haven't come up to it yet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.

speaker: Niles
text: [_at open door_] Knock, knock.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on in, Niles.  Bebe's just bringing me up to speed on her depressing news about my contract negotiations.

speaker: Bebe
text: Don't worry, dear, I just need to find a way to throw a scare into 'em.

speaker: Niles
text: Have you tried turning into a bat?

speaker: Bebe
text: I would, love, but most grown men don't share your fear of tiny creatures!

speaker: Frasier
text: Could you two please catch up later?

speaker: Bebe
text: I did get one offer that I thought might give us some leverage. It's a TV job.

speaker: Frasier
text: Television?

speaker: Bebe
text: Unfortunately it's all wrong for you.  They want you and Roz to host "AM Seattle" next week.

speaker: Niles
text: That vapid morning chat show?

speaker: Bebe
text: Exactly what I told them.  Frasier Crane is a doctor! He heals the masses, he doesn't pander to them.  He's not going to do some silly morning kaffeeklatch, no matter how fabulously popular it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's quite right, Bebe.  That sort of show, it's beneath me.

speaker: Bebe
text: Exactly.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's undignified.

speaker: Bebe
text: Horribly.

speaker: Frasier
text: Still...

speaker: Bebe
text: I'm listening.

speaker: Frasier
text: If there were a way to do it with a bit more dignity, some polish and substance...

speaker: Bebe
text: Why didn't I think of that?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, a dash of high society, a dollop of culture...

speaker: Niles
text: I can't believe you're even considering this.  The show is nothing more than a melange of bad jokes and mind-numbing banter.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, it doesn't have to be, Niles, don't you see?  I mean, if I could choose the guests myself-

speaker: Bebe
text: You can.

speaker: Frasier
text: And control the content-

speaker: Bebe
text: You could.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then, I'd accept.

speaker: Bebe
text: We did. [_realizes_] I mean, we will.  In fact, why don't I call them right now with the exciting news. [_takes out phone and a cigarette_] May I?

speaker: Frasier
text: On the balcony, if you don't mind.

speaker: Bebe
text: Mind?  I don't want a single puff tearing up the baby blues of TV's newest sensation.  By this time next week...

speaker: Niles
text: You heard him, if you're gonna blow smoke, do it on the balcony.  _Bebe looks daggers at Niles, then haughtily puts the cigarette between her lips and exits to the balcony._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I can't say I'm surprised.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is that supposed to mean?

speaker: Niles
text: Only that something like this was inevitable.  It's the final step in your descent from legitimate psychiatrist to dancing bear.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, we are talking about doing a sophisticated television show for one week in order to improve my contract negotiations.

speaker: Niles
text: This has nothing to do with your contract negotiations!  You have been an applause junky ever since you first set foot on a grammar school stage.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was drawn to the theatre because of its discipline and collaborative spirit!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh please, in your sixth grade production of "Oklahoma!" you took so many curtain calls, Mrs. Van Raphorst had to lasso you and pull you from the stage!

speaker: Frasier
text: That woman never understood me or the role of Farmer Number Three!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm just wasting my breath.  As usual you have fallen under the spell of that sorceress out there.

speaker: Frasier
text: I have done no such thing.  I wish you would just lay off of Bebe.  You know, she is not some malign witch who can transform people at will!  _Martin enters wearing his glasses and searching through Daphne's purse which is hung on his arm._

speaker: Martin
text: I can't find a damn thing in this purse! [_exits_]

speaker: Niles
text: If I say I'm sorry, will she change Dad back into a man?  _Frasier gives Niles a look.  End of Act One  Act Two  Scene One - TV Studio Frasier arrives with Bebe on the stage.  The producer, Matt, is standing by.  Some stage hands and makeup artists circle around Frasier, putting the final touches on his look._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it took several of your best people, but I believe they have finally wrestled this feisty cow-lick of mine into submission.  So, are we ready to roll?

speaker: Matt
text: Not quite, your partner's not here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz is not here?  But we're on in four minutes.

speaker: Matt
text: No, at this point a re-run is on in four minutes.

speaker: Bebe
text: Don't worry, Matt, she'll be here.

speaker: Matt
text: We won't even have time to put her through make-up.

speaker: Bebe
text: A natural beauty like Roz?  Oh, please, darling, pinch her cheeks, stand back and watch her glow.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, sorry I'm late.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, oh for God's sakes, you look awful, are you sick?

speaker: Roz
text: No, of course not, I wouldn't be sick for our big debut. I'm totally fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_feels her forehead_] Roz, you're burning up!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it's kinda hot in here, maybe it's all these lights. Let me just get this jacket off!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, Roz, stop, stop!

speaker: Matt
text: She's delirious!

speaker: Bebe
text: With anticipation, darling.  Don't worry, I'll calm her down.

speaker: Bebe
text: Pull yourself together, do you hear me?!  We need this show!

speaker: Matt
text: All right, everyone, we're doing a re-run, let the audience go, cue the tapes.

speaker: Bebe
text: Wait?  Can't Frasier do the show without her?

speaker: Matt
text: This is a chat show, who's he going to chat with?

speaker: Bebe
text: Me, I'll go on with him.

speaker: Frasier
text: You? [_shakes Roz_] Pull yourself together, Roz!

speaker: Matt
text: I don't think so, Bebe.

speaker: Bebe
text: Why not?  All he needs is someone to suck up to him, laugh at his jokes, pretend to listen to his stories.  I'm his agent, for God's sakes, that's what I do!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I believe she could pull it off.

speaker: Matt
text: The problem is she needs to be likable.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Do I at least get to keep the suit?

speaker: Bebe
text: Hold on, I can be likable.  I can also be very _un_ -likable. Maybe if you explained the difference to poor confused Bebe. For instance, what you were doing in the dressing room with the wardrobe girl an hour ago - would your wife find that likable or unlikable?

speaker: Matt
text: [_worried_] Could you put some make-up on this woman?

speaker: Manager
text: Okay, folks, sixty seconds.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Bebe, just follow my lead.  I'll introduce us and then I'll get to our guests, all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Wasn't our first guest Susan Sontag?

speaker: Bebe
text: She had a conflict.  Don't worry, we've got a fabulous replacement.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reading_] "Baby Leo, the world's biggest two year-old"?!

speaker: Bebe
text: You're gonna love him.  Just remember to lift with your legs.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_throws down the cards_] That's it, this is unacceptable.

speaker: Bebe
text: Ohhh, now who's the world's biggest baby?

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe, I will not do this show...!

speaker: Manager
text: [_over Frasier's protests_] And we're on in five, four... _Frasier and Bebe cease their arguing as the intro music starts and the audience applauds._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, welcome to "AM Seattle."  I'm Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Bebe
text: And I'm Bebe Glaser.

speaker: Frasier
text: We're gonna be your hosts this week and believe me, we've got some great shows lined up for you.  But before we get to our guests I'd like to take a few moments to share with you a few thoughts I've prepared on a very special time of the day, the time that we'll be spending together, morning.  A new beginning.  A daily rebirth, if you will.

speaker: Matt
text: What the hell is this?  Banter, banter. [_he mimes banter to Bebe_]

speaker: Frasier
text: And even though AM stands for Anti-Meridian, if you simply put them together, they also make up the word "am" as in "I am."

speaker: Bebe
text: Whoa!  Not before my coffee!  As you can see, Frasier has a way with words, but did you also know that he has a way with voices.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Bebe
text: Who wants to hear Frasier's famous Sean Connery impression?   [_N.B. They used the real studio audience that attended the filming of this episode._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Sean Connery voice_] Now, Now, Moneypenny, you're embarrassing me.

speaker: Bebe
text: Dr. Frasier Crane, ladies and gentlemen.  Anymore impressions, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what, maybe I should just get back to my...

speaker: Bebe
text: Now, don't be shy!  Who wants to hear Frasier do more impressions?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just that I'd hate to take time away from our other guests.  I believe that [_in James Mason voice_] James Mason may be stopping by to visit.   **I THINK THAT SMELL IS GREASE PAINT**  _Scene Two - TV Studio A few days later, Bebe and Frasier are presenting another show_

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this has been some week.

speaker: Bebe
text: It's really flown by.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hasn't it?

speaker: Bebe
text: Whoosh!

speaker: Frasier
text: A-whoosh!

speaker: Bebe
text: And there's even time for Thursday's kitchen corner.  We'll be right back with Chef Frasier.

speaker: Matt
text: And we're clear.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe, "Kitchen corner?"  I thought we had the violin prodigy up next.  For God sakes, we've bumped Kim Lee twice this week.

speaker: Bebe
text: I know, but we're running short of time and the cooking segment's going to be bopo!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, but I insist Kim Lee play over the closing credits, all right?  We're not running some sort of tacky, run-of-the-mill morning show! Director: Here's your chef's costume. [_he takes it in anguish_]

speaker: Bebe
text: Now, now, big dear.  You know, Frasier, the most magical thing happened to me last night during dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Bebe
text: I was recognized.

speaker: Frasier
text: Intoxicating, isn't it?  Gosh, I myself, no stranger to celebrity, have noticed more heads swiveling in my direction.

speaker: Matt
text: And we're back in five, four, three, two...

speaker: Frasier
text: Welcome back.

speaker: Bebe
text: Frasier, I hear you're quite the gourmet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh please, I don't do anything fancy.  A few souffles, a flambe or two, just good eats!  Now, this morning I'm going to be making my signature breakfast for you.  That's "Eggs Pelemo Fontana."

speaker: Bebe
text: Mmmm, makes my mouth water.  But before we start, I have a little sweetheart backstage who's dying to come out and give you a hand.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is it Kim Lee?

speaker: Bebe
text: Not even close.  It's Bobo, the cooking chimp!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_covering_] Ho-ho, that's very funny, it is.  This has Matt's fingerprints all over it!

speaker: Bebe
text: We thought it might be great fun if you were to match your skills against him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I don't know, Bebe.  Er....

speaker: Bebe
text: Well, let's let the audience decide.  How many of you want to see the monkey make eggs? [_they all clap_] Now, how many of you want to see Bobo make eggs?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ouch! [_laughs_] Well, all right, apes before beauty!

speaker: Bebe
text: Frasier, Bobo, may the best chef win!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, the first rule of boute cusine is to be sure that you have all of your ingredients at hand.  You see, we have eggs, milk, butter, spinach and of course our old friend, the shallot!

speaker: Frasier
text: Why, look at that, he's not even pre-heating the pan, the beast! [_laughs_]

speaker: Bebe
text: Bobo's getting an early lead.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's very important to keep your eggs light and fluffy, so what you want to do is add a bit of milk and a touch of flour.  _Bobo meanwhile throws an egg at Frasier.  They begin to have an improvised slinging match, throwing the eggs at each other.  CUT TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment That evening, Frasier, Daphne and Martin (wearing his women's glasses) are watching it on the television._

speaker: Frasier
text: Now this whole thing was improvised.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're kidding, it's like you and the chimp have been working together for years!

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, that's great stuff, Frasier.  You know, I can't tell you how impressed the guys at McGinty's are that I have such a famous son.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  What do they say?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, they don't say anything to my face, but when I walk in they kind of nudge each other and whisper.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_responding to a bell heard in the kitchen_] That'll be my Shepherd's Pie. [_exits to kitchen_]

speaker: Martin
text: Shepherd's Pie? [_takes glasses off_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I must confess, there's a part of me that wishes I could still do the TV show. [_doorbell_]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, there's a part of me that wishes that monkey was cooking dinner instead of you-know-who... but we put our dreams away!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Roz.  Well, don't you look nice.  Are you feeling better?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, thank you.  Can we talk?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course, come on in.  What's the matter?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I talked to my friends in business affairs and they say they're ready to close our deal but Bebe's holding it up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course she's holding it up, she's trying to make them sweat a little bit.  That's the whole strategy behind the TV show: leverage.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, well, I heard a rumor that "AM Seattle" isn't happy with their regular hosts and I think she's angling for you to take over.  So where does that leave me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, even if that was Bebe's plan, you're forgetting that it's still my career and I'm calling the shots.  There is no way I would continue doing "AM Seattle."

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, well, you look like you are having the time of your life.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm playing a character!  There is a big difference between "Dr. Frasier Crane, psychiatrist" and "Frasier Crane, the guy who starts your morning right."  I'll tell you what. I will speak to Bebe when we're in the chair.  Oh, that's the industry term for when we're getting our make-up put on.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks, Frasier. [_picks up Martin's glasses_] God, this is so weird!  Daphne usually has such great taste, what was she thinking with these glasses?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, Roz...

speaker: Roz
text: [_laughing, puts them on_] I've gotta go see what these look like.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey. [_she closes the door_]

speaker: Martin
text: He-he-he, somebody ought to tell Mr. Doyle she's wearing a dude's glasses!  _Frasier rolls his eyes.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Backstage Behind the scenes of "AM Seattle," Frasier is getting his make-up put on as Bebe enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Kiki, you're a magician.

speaker: Bebe
text: Frasier, you're not going to believe the wonderful news I just got: they want us to stay on.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?!

speaker: Bebe
text: Yes, we had the highest ratings the show's had all year.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't believe this, Roz was right.  You had no intention of negotiating my radio contract.

speaker: Bebe
text: ...I don't expect gratitude, Frasier.  Just a little faith. I finished your KACL contract this morning. [_hands it over_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You did?

speaker: Bebe
text: And I did quite a good job, I might add.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry, Bebe, I owe you an apology... [_reads it_] Well, this is wonderful, got an extra week's vacation and a very handsome raise.

speaker: Bebe
text: It's garbage compared to what they'll give us to stay on here. You'll get an expense account, a wardrobe allowance, not to mention a car and driver.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, let's not forget why I took this job.  It was to raise my profile, to get a better deal with the radio contract, and we've done that, Bebe.  And I thank you.

speaker: Bebe
text: You're welcome, darling, and I respect your choice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks.

speaker: Bebe
text: Now, let's talk about today's show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Bebe
text: We start with the Friday Fiesta, here are our costumes... [_hands over Mexican ponchos_] and then we move on to the Girl Scout cookie-selling champ... [_Bebe turns to tears_] and then we...

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe, are you all right?

speaker: Bebe
text: I spent my life in the wings, it was just nice having my moment in the spotlight.  The rush when that little red light on camera turns on... [_captivating him_] The stupid masking tape on that dressing room door with my name on it...

speaker: Frasier
text: The stage door johnnys, or whatever that strange man with the autograph book calls himself...

speaker: Bebe
text: Admit it, darling, you want this as much as I do.  I saw it in your eyes during the pie-eating contest.  Nobody loves blueberries that much, it's the audience you love!

speaker: Announcer
text: [_o.s._] Are you ready for Bebe and Frasier?

speaker: Bebe
text: Listen to them!  They want you!

speaker: Frasier
text: They do want me, don't they?

speaker: Bebe
text: Tell me to tear up the contract, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe it is time for a change...

speaker: Niles
text: [_moves in_] Get away from him, you she-thing!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: It's a good thing Dad started choking on that peanut or I would have never come back here for water.  Stop this madness!

speaker: Bebe
text: He can't stop it, no one can, show business is in his blood!

speaker: Niles
text: No, psychiatry is.  Frasier, you're a healer.

speaker: Bebe
text: Anyone can heal.  You're better than that, [_eyes light up_] you're an entertainer!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, Niles, she's right.  I love the audience.  I know it's shallow but it makes me feel alive.

speaker: Niles
text: Do you have any idea how ridiculous you look in this outfit? Frasier, I know I sometimes I make light of your radio show, but the truth is you provide help and hope and comfort to people who need it.  I have always envied you that.

speaker: Bebe
text: Don't listen to that drivel!

speaker: Frasier
text: He's right, Bebe.  I'm a psychiatrist, I can't do the show anymore.  I'm sorry.

speaker: Bebe
text: Then quit!  Who needs ya?  I'll find some other stuffed shirt who's happy to ride my coat tails to fame. [_beat_] Niles, you're a doctor.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stands between them_] Niles, don't look into her eyes!

speaker: Bebe
text: Well, that's it... the dream is over.

speaker: Matt
text: [_o.s._] Thirty seconds!

speaker: Bebe
text: But I'm still a professional. [_puts on her oversized sombrero_] There's an audience out there waiting for two people to ride in on a donkey.  I don't know about you, but I'm not going to let them down. [_mounts the donkey_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_off Frasier's glance_] It's your last show.  Get out there!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, brother, for keeping me grounded. _Frasier then puts his Mexican hat on and clambers onto the donkey and sets out to the stage._

speaker: Niles
text: _Vaya Con Dios!_

speaker: Announcer
text: [_o.s._] And here they are, Bebe and Frasier!
